title: Understanding Rotations of Conics
text: Consider the goal of eliminating the xy-term in the conic equation by rotating the coordinate system. This is done using rotation formulas for conics, which involve converting xy terms into x'y' terms.

title: Identifying the Rotation Angle
text: The angle of rotation, theta, for eliminating the xy-term is found using the formula $$tan\left(2\theta\right)=\frac{B}{A-C}$$. For this specific equation, identify A, B, and C before calculating theta.

title: Calculate A, B, and C
text: Given the equation $$13x^2-6\sqrt{3} x y+7y^2=16$$, identify the values of A, B, and C. What are the values respectively? Please enter your answer in the for of $$A=?$$, $$B=?$$, $$C=$$? replacing the question marks with the answer.

title: Find Theta Using the Tan Formula
text: Using $$tan\left(2\theta\right)=\frac{B}{A-C}$$ with the calculated A, B, and C values, find the angle theta needed for the rotation. What is theta?

title: Apply the Rotation Matrix
text: Use the rotation matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} costheta & sintheta & -sintheta & costheta \end{bmatrix}$$ to transform the original equation's terms. What is the rotated equation?
